intro: Alsine austriaca, commonly known as Austrian sandwort, is a low-growing annual herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically reaches a height of 5–15 cm and features a sprawling, prostrate growth habit. The plant has small, oval to elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pale blue to white, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Alsine austriaca thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
